bug.author: hipwelljo
bug.summary: Exception on teardown with drawing classifier

comments.comment: I don't think the exceptions on teardown are the problem. I think the problem is that the process is getting killed. After looking into things a bit, I'm almost certain the issue is in the call. Calculating the confusion matrix is very expensive. I just created <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/3315>#3315</denchmark-link> to track this issue separately. Also unfortunately the method for the Drawing Classifier always calculates a confusion matrix, regardless of input. We're now tracking that issues in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/3316>#3316</denchmark-link> . Please confirm that you don't get any errors in your script if you remove the call to evaluate. To get test accuracy, you should be able to do: tc.evaluation.accuracy(predictions, test['label']) Given your large number of classes, getting a confusion matrix isn't really feasible at this time.

I tried this out and received the same result, exception on teardown, after removing the evaluate call. I changed it to: <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label')
model.save('Symbols.model')
predictions = model.predict(test_data)
print(tc.evaluation.accuracy(predictions, test['label'])) </denchmark-code>
And it did not save the model on disk so it appears to be encountered at the end of the model creation.

I'm not sure what's going on here. If you get a chance, please try creating the model without an automatically generated validation set. i.e. rather than: <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label') </denchmark-code>
please try: <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label', validation_set=None) </denchmark-code>

Interesting, I no longer get the exception on teardown messaging, just: <denchmark-code> | 495 | 0.985295 | 3h 20m | | 496 | 0.986832 | 3h 21m | | 497 | 0.991473 | 3h 21m | | 498 | 0.99022 | 3h 22m | | 499 | 0.985209 | 3h 22m | | 500 | 0.984441 | 3h 23m | +--------------+----------------+--------------+ zsh: killed python3 2_train.py (venv) Jordan@Jordans-MacBook-Pro Drawing Classification % </denchmark-code>
And Symbols.model is not saved on disk.

So <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/0718723f8368aec7328aa4d7018dc7d5d63028ac/src/toolkits/drawing_classifier/drawing_classifier.cpp#L692>the footer of the progress table is getting printed</denchmark-link> . Since should be true, there isn't much else going on in . Perhaps exporting the model to CoreML is the issue. It would be helpful if you could determine if it's getting killed in tc.drawing_classifier.create and model.save. You may be able to reproduce this issue much faster by passing max_iterations=1 to the tc.drawing_classifier.create. I'm curious if that reproduces the issue.

Ok it does occur with just one iteration, thank goodness. I changed it to: <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label', validation_set=None, max_iterations=1) print("Model created") model.save('Symbols.model') print("Model saved") </denchmark-code>
The results: <denchmark-code>(venv) Jordan@Jordans-MacBook-Pro Drawing Classification % python3 2_train.py WARNING:tensorflow:From /Users/Jordan/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/resource_variable_ops.py:1666: calling BaseResourceVariable.__init__ (from tensorflow.python.ops.resource_variable_ops) with constraint is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Instructions for updating: If using Keras pass *_constraint arguments to layers. Using CPU to create model. +--------------+----------------+--------------+ | Iteration | Train Accuracy | Elapsed Time | +--------------+----------------+--------------+ | 1 | 0 | 22.81s | +--------------+----------------+--------------+ zsh: killed python3 2_train.py (venv) Jordan@Jordans-MacBook-Pro Drawing Classification % Exception on teardown. Exception on teardown. </denchmark-code>
It did sit there after it logged the table for about 2 minutes while using ~100% CPU before it was killed if that's helpful. I ran it again and got some additional info and a Python crash report window appeared. <denchmark-code>+--------------+----------------+--------------+ | Iteration | Train Accuracy | Elapsed Time | +--------------+----------------+--------------+ | 1 | 0 | 22.25s | +--------------+----------------+--------------+ zsh: killed python3 2_train.py (venv) Jordan@Jordans-MacBook-Pro Drawing Classification % Exception on teardown. Exception on teardown. libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type boost::filesystem::filesystem_error: boost::filesystem::directory_iterator::operator++: No such file or directory: "/var/folders/0d/n5np5bmn5m70htsghj_26kp40000gn/T/turicreate-Jordan/69494" Exception on teardown. </denchmark-code>

Using synthetic data with approximately the same number of rows and labels, I'm not able to reproduce this behavior. Two questions: 1 - Does this happen every time or only intermittently? 2 - How much RAM do you have? Please share any system logs that get generated. Run the following command: tail -f /var/log/system.log. Then in a second terminal window, run your script. What gets printed in the first window?

Every time 16 GB
It doesn't appear to log anything related to this issue: <denchmark-code>Sep 11 14:43:09 Jordans-MacBook-Pro xpcproxy[19250]: libcoreservices: _dirhelper_userdir: 557: bootstrap_look_up returned (ipc/send) invalid destination port Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: Entered:_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8014 Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: Entered:__thr_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8014 Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: tid:5503 - Mux ID not found in mapping dictionary Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: tid:5503 - Can't handle disconnect with invalid ecid Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: Entered:_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8014 Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: Entered:__thr_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8014 Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: tid:121ef - Mux ID not found in mapping dictionary Sep 11 14:43:20 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: tid:121ef - Can't handle disconnect with invalid ecid Sep 11 14:43:43 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: Entered:_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8015 Sep 11 14:43:43 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: Entered:_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8015 Sep 11 14:43:43 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: Entered:__thr_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8015 Sep 11 14:43:43 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: Entered:__thr_AMMuxedDeviceDisconnected, mux-device:8015 Sep 11 14:43:43 Jordans-MacBook-Pro AMPDeviceDiscoveryAgent[15314]: tid:121f3 - Can't handle disconnect with invalid ecid Sep 11 14:43:43 Jordans-MacBook-Pro MobileDeviceUpdater[15299]: tid:5507 - Can't handle disconnect with invalid ecid Sep 11 14:43:47 Jordans-MacBook-Pro syncdefaultsd[19253]: objc[19253]: Class SYDClient is implemented in both /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/SyncedDefaults.framework/Versions/A/SyncedDefaults and /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/SyncedDefaults.framework/Support/syncdefaultsd. One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined. One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined. Since I can't reproduce the issue, I'm not sure how much more help I can be here. Would it be possible for you to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/master/BUILD.md#compiling>compile a local debug version of TuriCreate</denchmark-link> and use that? Then you either add debugging print statements or attach a debugger to your process.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/TobyRoseman>@TobyRoseman</denchmark-link> I could send you my images.sframe and the script, do you think then it would reproduce on your end?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hipwelljo>@hipwelljo</denchmark-link> - even with your data, I still may not be able to reproduce it. Let's take this discussion offline. Please send me an email. My email address can be found on my GitHub profile page.
